admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"getTokenAddress()":{"returns":{"_0":"the address locating the token contract"}},"getWorkById(uint256)":{"params":{"id":"the identifier corresponding to the proposal in the proposals set"},"returns":{"_0":"the work stored in the proposals set related to the id provided"}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"impartialSelection(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"k":"the number of winners to select","randomness":"the randomness used to select the allocation of winners per cluster to use"}},"isImpartialSelection()":{"returns":{"_0":"the value resulting from the check"}},"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"data":"eventual data transferred","from":"the owner of the token","operator":"the address transferring the token","tokenId":"the token id"},"returns":{"_0":"the selector of the function"}},"provideAssignments(uint256[][])":{"params":{"assignments":"the assignment to be stored"}},"providePartition(uint256[][])":{"params":{"part":"the partition to be stored"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revealEvaluations(uint256,uint256,uint256[],uint256[])":{"params":{"evaluations":"the evaluations proposed for the reviews assigned, used to generate the commitment","randomness":"the randomness used to generate the commitment","tokenId":"the token id associated to the proposal for which the assignment was generated"},"returns":{"_0":"the assignment used to generate the commitment"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. documentation.text: @notice checks if the user requesting a transaction is authorized to execute it

@notice creates a new instance of the contract and connects the PET token contract
 @param tokenAddress address of the PET token to connect to the contract

@notice used by the token to check if the invoking contract is an instance of an impartial selection contract
 @return the value resulting from the check
@notice sets the following contract as a minter for PET tokens

@notice getter returning the token contract
 @return the address locating the token contract

@notice updates the current phase of the contract
 @param p the phase the contract should be put in

@notice getter returning the current phase of the contract
 @return a value from the Phases enumeration, representing current state of the contract
@notice ends submission phase and starts assignment phase
@notice ends assignment phase and starts commitment phase
@notice ends commitment phase and starts reveal phase
@notice ends reveal phase and starts selection phase

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256[] memory[] memory,uint256) pure returns (uint256[] memory[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice getter returning the clusters in which the proposals are divided
 @return the unzipped version of partition data structure, storing clusters

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Allocations.Map storage pointer) view returns (uint256[] memory[] memory,uint256[] memory)

 @return the list of possible allocations and a list of their corresponding probabilities of being selected

function (uint256[] storage ref[] storage pointer,mapping(uint256 => uint256),struct Allocations.Map storage pointer,uint256,uint256)

params.tokenId: the token id associated to the proposal for which the assignment was generated

params.tokenAddress: address of the PET token to connect to the contract

params.l: the number of clusters to create

params.m: the number of reviews assigned to each user

returns._0: the list of possible allocations and a list of their corresponding probabilities of being selected

params.id: the identifier corresponding to the proposal in the proposals set

returns._0: the list of proposals assigned for the review to the id specified

params.tokenId: the token id corresponding to the proposal for which the assignment is required

returns._0: the list of proposals assigned for the review to the owner of the token identified by tokenId
a value from the Phases enumeration, representing current state of the contract
the unzipped version of partition data structure, storing clusters

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

returns._0: the address locating the token contract

params.id: the identifier corresponding to the proposal in the proposals set

returns._0: the work stored in the proposals set related to the id provided

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.k: the number of winners to select
params.randomness: the randomness used to select the allocation of winners per cluster to use

returns._0: the value resulting from the check

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

params.evaluations: the evaluations proposed for the reviews assigned, used to generate the commitment
params.randomness: the randomness used to generate the commitment
params.tokenId: the token id associated to the proposal for which the assignment was generated

returns._0: the assignment used to generate the commitment

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.p: the phase the contract should be put in

params.work: the work an agent wishes to submit

commitEvaluations(bytes32,uint256).notice: stores a commitment of the evaluations for the assigned reviews on the blockchain, after verifying that the user is authorized

methods.constructor: creates a new instance of the contract and connects the PET token contract

createPartition(uint256).notice: creates a partition of the proposals using the algorithm defined in the library

endAssignmentPhase().notice: ends assignment phase and starts commitment phase

endCommitmentPhase().notice: ends commitment phase and starts reveal phase

endRevealPhase().notice: ends reveal phase and starts selection phase

endSubmissionPhase().notice: ends submission phase and starts assignment phase

finalizeCreation().notice: sets the following contract as a minter for PET tokens

generateAssignments(uint256).notice: creates the review assignments to the proposals using the algorithm defined in the library

getAllocations().notice: getter returning the different possible combinations of winners per cluster found by the apportionment algorithm

getAssignmentById(uint256).notice: getter returning the reviews assignment correponding to a given proposal id

getAssignmentByToken(uint256).notice: getter returning the reviews assignment correponding to a given tokenId

getCurrentPhase().notice: getter returning the current phase of the contract

getPartition().notice: getter returning the clusters in which the proposals are divided

getWorkById(uint256).notice: getter returning the work proposed by a specified proposal id

impartialSelection(uint256,uint256).notice: executes the actual selection by invoking Exact Dollar Partition

isImpartialSelection().notice: used by the token to check if the invoking contract is an instance of an impartial selection contract

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.notice: callback invoked on receiving a token

provideAssignments(uint256[][]).notice: provides an externally created assignment of the reviews to store on the blockchain

providePartition(uint256[][]).notice: provides an externally created partition of the proposals to store on the blockchain

revealEvaluations(uint256,uint256,uint25.notice: reveals the content of the commitment and checks the correspondance with the one stored on the blockchain

setCurrentPhase(uint8).notice: updates the current phase of the contract

submitWork(bytes).notice: used to submit a work to the system and to receive the corresponding token minted

userdoc.notice: smart contract implementing the base system proposed, no scores data structure supplied, needs to be extended
